info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 13 at 2:55AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST SOUTH DAKOTA, NORTHWEST IOWA, AND SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA... .DISCUSSION... Issued at 247 AM CDT Thu Apr 13 2023 The cold front that is currently draped across the heart of the coverage area should lift back northwest this afternoon with another very warm and dry day ahead of it. Afternoon minimum RH values look to fall into at least the 20-25% range, perhaps a bit lower if the better mixed RAP/HRRR continue to verify. At the same time, southerly winds will gust as high as 30-40+ mph, highest across NW IA. This will result in critical and dangerous fire weather conditions across much of the coverage area, with rapid spread of any new fire starts. Previously issued Red Flag Warning still looks fully justified and did expand an additional row of counties on the northern/western flank. Biggest questions still revolve around the exact placement of the front by afternoon as well as the fuel conditions closer to the Hwy 14 corridor and along the Buffalo Ridge where snowmelt was more recent. Will want to monitor these locations closely as critical meteorological conditions may extend outside of the current warning, fuel status is just the uncertainty. A sharp cold front will push through Friday bringing falling temperatures and precipitation chances. People are urged to exercise extreme care with respect to outdoor activities that could cause grass fires. Avoid equipment that can cause sparks near dry grass or brush. Do not toss cigarettes on the ground. Report new fires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly, becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. OUTLOOK FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON...The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the high category. The grassland fire danger product reflects fire danger for native grasses. It is not intended for cured agricultural crops, nor will it reflect conditions in road ditches which have been mowed.
